name: acknowledge
content:

C1 to accept, admit, or recognize something, or the truth or existence of something: acknowledge someone as something Historians generally acknowledge her as a genius in her field. [ + -ing verb ] She acknowledged having been at fault. [ + that ] She acknowledged that she had been at fault. You must acknowledge the truth of her argument. [ + obj + to infinitive ] She is usually acknowledged to be one of our best artists. They refused to acknowledge (= to recognize officially) the new government. The government won't even acknowledge the existence of the problem.
